name: BGP, some Python, and a DB
desc: Presentation given at BSidesWpg 2015. How do services like BGPmon and Dyn provide Internet Intelligence? This talk described the process of building a small-scale BGP update logger, running it on a single AS, and then scaling it up.

name: SaltStack (for System Administrators)
desc: Presentation given at MUUG Meeting February 2015. An overview for beginners who have never used SaltStack before. Covering everything from installation, basic commands, templating, states, pillars, and of course mass deployment/upgrades.

name: Managing Nagios Configs with Git
desc: One of the complaints I often hear from people unfamiliar with Nagios is how complex the config files are. Back up configs, while keeping diffs of each batch of changes made. Use git! (INCOMPLETE)

name: IPv6 Introduction
desc: Presentation being prepared for delivery at an upcoming Skullspace Hackathon. Topics to include: standards, addressing, subnetting, new IPv6 concepts (SLAAC, “Happy Eyes”), and a lengthy Q and A session. (INCOMPLETE)

name: Intro Linux Security 2
desc: Canadian Cyber Defense Challenge Prep, Presentation delivered to a full classroom of interested highschool students, Skullspace Classroom.

name: InfoSec from an ISP’s Perspective
desc: Presentation given at BSidesWpg 2013 on current security issues facing Internet Service Providers and other large networks. Notable topics include: BGP Hijacking, Spoofed packets, Abusable UDP Services & DDoS Attacks.

name: Hextet BGP API
desc: An API to expose BGP information given an IP address

name: exabgp logger
desc: Source code of backend written for BSidesWpg2015 Talk

name: ipaddr.ca
desc: A website which tells you your IPv4 and IPv6 address, with a funny looking bird. Makes jQuery calls to an API endpoint written in Go.
